its how the drivers/udev pickup the devices. You can mess with the OS to change it. afaik, network manager expects wlan0 but wicd is more flexible and allows you to specify the wireless interface name

the interfaces file will always output the same thing as interfaces will only define the loopback device, the rest is managed (by default) by network manager
the board and cpu are moot, its the wireless hardware which makes the difference, and the driver running it, thereof
